repnme.cdata!:
El Salvador - First Broad-Based Growth
            Development Policy Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the First Broad-Based Growth
            Development Policy Loan (DPL) Project for El Salvador were
            as follows: outcomes were satisfactory, the risk to
            development outcome was moderate, Bank performance was
            highly satisfactory, and Borrower performance was
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: The
            government's strong ownership of the program was
            critical for a successful outcome. The satisfactory outcome
            of the DPL I and the completion of the DPL II actions were
            to a large extent a consequence of the government commitment
            to achieve the medium-term targets and to present to the
            National Assembly the legal reforms necessary for its
            successful implementation. The latter were achieved through
            a consensus-building process with the Opposition at the
            beginning of the new administration. As this Implementation,
            Completion and Results Report (ICR) review has demonstrated,
            the government has made substantial progress toward
            achieving the medium-term objectives established for the
            programmatic series of four DPL despite the fact that only
            one of them was approved and executed. The Bank should
            examine the possibility, when the risk of a political
            gridlock is high, to approve the total amount of the DPL
            series which will be activated and disbursed gradually once
            compliance of the relevant medium term triggers occur. This
            policy will facilitate negotiations between the Executive
            and Legislative branches of Government, when the opposition
            has control over the latter, avoiding lengthy and costly
            negotiations every year.

repnme.cdata!:
El Salvador - Programmatic Broad-Based
            Growth Development Support Loan Project : seventh quality at
            entry assessment (QEA7) - fiscal year 2004-2005

abstracts.cdata!:
The panel was impressed by the quality
            of design of the First Programmatic Broad-Based Growth
            Development Policy Loan (DPL) to El-Salvador-as part of a
            programmatic series of four DPLs intended to support the
            government's medium-term development strategy and rated
            as highly satisfactory. This operation was correctly focused
            on the initial building blocks: (a) fiscal measures to meet
            the challenges of stemming growth of debt and preserving
            space for key growth-related and social investments; and (b)
            growth, with special emphasis on measures related to
            widening trade opportunities as well as continuing public
            sector modernization efforts. The subsequent DPLs are
            intended to support the broader development agenda of
            private sector development, institutional
            development/capacity building, and infrastructure
            development. This DPL and the three planned additional
            operations are intended to contribute to the
            government's objectives of re-igniting growth,
            particularly through increased trade and investment,
            reinforcing macroeconomic stability and strengthening fiscal
            sustainability, and increasing the efficiency and
            transparency of public sector management. This operation
            will help El Salvador meet its fiscal needs, supporting the
            government's goals of fiscal stabilization and
            efficiency in spending, endorse sound policies, become the
            vehicle for securing overall continuity of the Bank's
            policy dialogue with El Salvador, and strengthen the
            Bank's reputation as a reliable development partner.

5828504.majtheme: Public sector governance,Trade and integration,Financial and private sector development,Economic management

repnme.cdata!:
El Salvador - Broad-based Growth
            Development Policy Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Programmatic Development Policy Loan
            for El Salvador is part of a Programmatic series of four
            development policy loans intended to support the
            Government's medium term development strategy to
            accelerate broad based and equitable economic growth and to
            contribute to the Government's objectives of (1)
            reigniting growth, particularly through increased private
            investment and trade; (2) reinforcing macroeconomic
            stability and strengthening fiscal sustainability; and (3)
            increasing the efficiency and transparency of public sector
            management. The first area includes policies to expand trade
            opportunities and improve the investment climate. The second
            area highlights measures related to expanding tax revenues,
            reducing the fiscal burden of pension reform and
            strengthening the financial sector. The third area supports
            public sector modernization efforts, with emphasis on the
            areas of procurement, e-government and public financial management.
